page.title: 16Footpaths
page.content: The footpaths in the area cross the farmland to connect Wing with Mentmore and Crafton, and Ledburn with Mentmore. Some of these are rarely used and it is only recently that 'Public Footpath' signs have been erected to show their positions. This follows a heightening of interest with the formation of local footpath societies and ramblers' clubs. In fact, the path which crosses Ledburn Farm is now ploughed, although access is not restricted. It is cheaper for the farmer to plough a whole field, which he has done because the path is hardly ever used. All these paths cross the stream, a tributary of the River Ousel, at tiny bridges at intervals along its course.
